p: In clinical examination on admission, cutaneous findings included sore infiltrated purplish papulonodular lesions on both the forearms ( Figure 1(a)), with a rapid extension on the two hands ( Figure 1(b)). Papillomatous, palmoplantar skin lesions, as well as important lymphedema of the extremities were also observed (Figures 1(c) and 1(d)). Pleuro-pulmonary examination showed no abnormality and the rest of physical assessment had no peculiarities.
